content:
Lovebox是一个为期三天的音乐节。 2018年，该活动搬到了伦敦的Gunnersbury公园。 这次搬迁是在Tower Hamlets拒绝其继续在维多利亚公园举办的申请，以及兰贝斯居民反对其搬到布洛克威尔公园之后进行的。 2019年的活动可容纳50,000人。

 

该活动自2002年开始举办，由DJ Groove Armada创办。 在此期间，Lovebox还在纽卡斯尔、都柏林和伊比沙岛举办过活动，也举办过许多派对和俱乐部之夜。

 

起源和历史

2002年，Groove Armada将Lovebox作为伦敦93 Feet East场地的一个常驻俱乐部之夜。

 

2003年，为了庆祝这个夜晚的一周年，他们两人举办了第一次户外Lovebox活动。 这场为期一天的活动于2003年6月底在克拉珀姆公地举行，可容纳10,000人。 该活动的门票在两天内售罄。 该活动由一个现场主舞台、三个小型舞蹈舞台以及酒吧和食品摊组成。

 

2004年，该活动再次举办，容量扩大到20,000人。 该活动在三天内售罄。 Lovebox还在纽卡斯尔赛马场举办了一个姐妹节，并举行了一个会后派对。

 

2005年，Lovebox搬到了Tower Hamlets的维多利亚公园。 该音乐节扩大到两天，可容纳25,000人。 该活动由Groove Armada和Mylo共同主持，有四个舞蹈帐篷、两个卡巴莱舞台、一个1900年代的Spiegel帐篷和一个游乐场。

 

从2007年到2008年，Lovebox在都柏林举办了一个姐妹活动。

 

到2009年，Lovebox已经增加到可以容纳50,000人，场地面积达40英亩（160,000平方米）。

 

Lovebox还在伦敦的The End、Turnmills、Neighbourhood、Canvas、The Key和The Ministry of Sound以及布莱顿、都柏林、贝尔法斯特、爱丁堡、纽卡斯尔和伊比沙岛的其他地方举办过晚会，并举办了每年一度的夏季游艇派对，一直持续到2008年。

 

2010年，该音乐节被扩大为为期三天的活动，但值得注意的是，Groove Armada没有出现在阵容中。

 

自2014年起，Lovebox又被缩减为两天的活动。

 

2014年，Lovebox推出了After Dark，这是一个系列的派对，在音乐节的周五和周六晚上之后，在东伦敦的一些俱乐部空间举行，包括Oval Space、The Laundry和Village Underground。 在After Dark表演过的艺人包括Bonobo、Modeselektor、Shy FX、Soul Clap和Scuba。

 

节日文化

尽管一开始是一个以舞蹈为主的节日，但Lovebox后来扩展到包括各种音乐类型，包括hip hop, indie, rock, grime, world 和pop音乐，以及马戏团表演者、歌舞表演和边缘表演。 2009年，该音乐节举办了七个舞台，得到了包括Gaymers Cider、Relentless和Rizla等品牌的各种合作支持 。

 

到2015年，该音乐节已经举办了12个舞台，与包括Noisey、BBC Radio 1Xtra、Essential Mix、Thump Records、Mountain Dew和Corona等品牌的合作。

 

Lovebox也以非常有创意的活动而闻名，舞台和区域都被精心建造和装扮。 2009年的音乐节现场有一个树屋、一个保龄球馆、一个古董时装展和一个治疗和按摩区，以及几个主题酒吧和饮食区。

 

2014年，《秘密花园派对》的联合组织者和《荒野》的联合创始人Secret Productions加入了Lovebox。从那时起，该场地还举办了艺术装置、滚筒迪斯科、走秀表演和主题酒吧。

 

Lovebox位于伦敦市中心，但仍然包含了许多乡村活动的特点，如格拉斯顿伯里和秘密花园派对，它已经发展成为一个 "以城市为基础但又有乡村感觉的多维节日--没有露营或无尽的跋涉"。

 

Lovebox 节赢得了一系列奖项。 2006 年，它凭借舞蹈音乐获得了虚拟节日派对人物奖。 2008 年，Lovebox 赢得了英国最佳中型音乐节奖。
contentEn:
Lovebox is a three-day[1] music festival. In 2018 the event moved to Gunnersbury Park, London. The move came after Tower Hamlets turned down its application to continue in Victoria Park and Lambeth residents objected to its move to Brockwell Park. The 2019 event had a capacity of 50,000.[2]

 

The event has been running since 2002 and was founded by DJs Groove Armada. During this time, Lovebox has also hosted events in Newcastle, Dublin and Ibiza as well as numerous parties and club nights.[3]

 

Origins and history

Groove Armada began Lovebox as a resident club night at London venue 93 Feet East in 2002.[4]

 

In 2003 to celebrate the first anniversary of the night, the pair hosted the first outdoor Lovebox event. The one-day event was held at the end of June 2003, on Clapham Common with a capacity of 10,000. Tickets for the event sold out in two days. The event consisted of one live main stage, three smaller dance stages plus bars and food stalls.[3]

 

In 2004, the event was repeated with an expanded capacity of 20,000. The event sold out within three days. Lovebox also hosted a sister festival on Newcastle Racecourse followed by an after party.[5]

 

In 2005, Lovebox moved to Victoria Park in Tower Hamlets. The festival expanded to two days and a capacity of 25,000. The event was co-headlined by Groove Armada and Mylo and featured four dance tents, two cabaret arenas, a 1900s Spiegel tent and a funfair.[5]

 

From 2007 until 2008, Lovebox hosted a sister event in Dublin.

 

By 2009, Lovebox had increased to a capacity of 50,000 and a 40-acre (160,000 m2) site.[3]

 

Lovebox has also hosted nights at The End, Turnmills, Neighbourhood, Canvas, The Key and The Ministry of Sound in London and elsewhere in Brighton, Dublin, Belfast, Edinburgh, Newcastle and Ibiza, as well as an annual summer boat party, which ran until 2008.[5]

 

For 2010, the festival was expanded to a three-day event,[3] notable however for the fact that Groove Armada were missing from the lineup.

 

Since 2014, Lovebox has been reduced back to a two-day event.[1]

 

In 2014, Lovebox launched After Dark, a series of parties held after both the Friday and Saturday nights of the festival across a selection of East London club spaces, including Oval Space, The Laundry and Village Underground. Acts that have performed at After Dark include Bonobo, Modeselektor, Shy FX, Soul Clap and Scuba.

 

Festival culture

Despite starting out as a predominantly dance festival, Lovebox has since expanded to include a wide variety of musical genres including hip hop, indie, rock, grime, world and pop, as well as circus performers, cabaret and fringe acts. In 2009 the festival hosted seven stages, supported by various partnerships from brands including Gaymers Cider, Relentless and Rizla.[3]

 

By 2015, the festival had hosted twelve stages, in association with partnerships from brands including Noisey, BBC Radio 1Xtra, Essential Mix, Thump Records, Mountain Dew and Corona.

 

Lovebox is also known for being a very creative-led event, with stages and areas being elaborately built and dressed. The 2009 festival site featured a tree house, a bowling alley, a vintage fashion fair and a healing and massage area as well as several themed bars and eating areas.[3]

 

In 2014, Secret Productions, co-organisers of Secret Garden Party and co-founders of Wilderness, joined Lovebox.[6] Ever since, the site has also hosted art installations, a roller disco, walkabout acts and themed bars.

 

Being based in central London, yet still encompassing many of the features of country-set events such as Glastonbury and Secret Garden Party, Lovebox has developed a reputation for being an “urban-based-yet-rural-feeling, multi-dimensional festival – without the camping or the endless tramping about.”[7]

 

Lovebox Festival has won a selection of awards. In 2006, it won Virtual Festivals Party People Award for Dance Music.[8] In 2008 Lovebox won the UK Festival Award for Best Medium-Sized Festival.[9]

 

References

  1. ^ Jump up to:a b "Lovebox Festival". Lovebox Festival.
  2. ^ "Lovebox Weekender 2019". eFestivals. Retrieved 15 December 2020.
  3. ^ Jump up to:a b c d e f "Lovebox Festival". Lovebox Festival.
  4. ^ "Groove Armada takes LoveBox to Clapham Common". Resident Advisor.
  5. ^ Jump up to:a b c "Lovebox Weekender - Sunday". Resident Advisor.
  6. ^ "Lovebox & Secret Productions - Lovebox Festival". Lovebox Festival. Retrieved 2016-01-06.
  7. ^ "Time Out Lovebox Weekender". Time Out London.
  8. ^ Virtual Festivals Article 2006 Archived 2012-02-25 at the Wayback Machine
  9. ^ "Virtual Festivals Article 2008". Archived from the original on 2009-05-01. Retrieved 2010-01-27.
